articleContent.title: Arpeggio: Minor 7th in G
articleContent.content:
# Arpeggio: Minor 7th in G

## Brief Overview
An arpeggio is a musical technique where the notes of a chord are played in a series rather than simultaneously. In this case, the arpeggio is based on the G minor 7th chord. 

## Notes and Intervals
The G minor 7th arpeggio consists of the following notes and intervals:

- G (Root)
- Bb (Minor 3rd)
- D (Perfect 5th)
- F (Minor 7th)

## Musical Flavor and Genre
The G minor 7th arpeggio has a smooth and jazzy flavor to it, commonly used in jazz, R&B, soul, and funk music genres. It adds a touch of sophistication and melancholy to the music due to the minor quality of the chord.

## Examples in Songs
Here are three songs that feature the G minor 7th arpeggio:
1. **"So What" by Miles Davis**: This jazz classic prominently features the G minor 7th arpeggio in various improvisational sections.
2. **"Natural Woman" by Aretha Franklin**: The G minor 7th arpeggio is used in this soulful ballad to create emotive chord progressions.
3. **"Isn't She Lovely" by Stevie Wonder**: The G minor 7th arpeggio can be heard in this funk/soul hit, adding depth and richness to the harmonic structure of the song.
